reviews.text: Agree so much with the other reviews. Despite the recent re-fit, this place still doesn't live up to its potential. The problem, quite frankly, is the staff and I think the kitchen is where the real issues lie. The wait for food is absolutely ridiculous considering most of is made up of 'ding ding' meals. On several occasions I have overheard bar staff, including management, moaning about those working in the kitchen. But the bar is far from perfect either - I have seen glasses outside go uncollected for up to an hour which renders tables unusable, and the bar is often unstaffed when I am in there. If it had a better reputation for food we would pop in on a regular basis, but at the moment the best they can hope from us is the odd drink every now and again. Needs selling to the likes of those who run the Devon Doorway, who could strip it out and start again.
reviews.title: Still got so much unmet potential

reviews.text: oh dear - where to start? Its not good and as I live locally I would love to visit to eat as well as drink. I tried the pub again recently and was told there was a one hour (at least) wait for food, this has happened to me quite a few times. I dont get it. They serve pub food, which I assume has been heated up or cooked in a microwave because it tastes and looks like that. So how can they not cope when the numbers are up. Last time I went they had a function on but let people buy drinks and then told them they would have to wait a long time for food and handed out free bottles of wine. Message to the brewery. Please do something about this pub you have competition now across the road and you will lose local custom.
reviews.title: beautiful building and lovely gardens but that's it

reviews.text: Went for a slow bite to eat on Sunday at the green lodge!!! Understandably busy with the egg run being on but not impressed in the slightest! First when we tried to order a drink at the bar was told someone would come and take our order at the table, 15 mins later when this had not happened I asked someone who said they would get someone to come over. 5 mins later someone came and took our order for drinks and food, it then took 20 mins for 2 of the 4 drinks we ordered to arrive, almost 10 mins later I had to ask at the bar if there was any chance we could have our other 2 drinks!! When our starters arrived we were given a plate of nacho crumbs which came with the added bonus of peas!! We asked for them to be changed only to be told there was none left! Our other starter the combo was ok. When the mains arrived the chips were luke warm and one of our party who had ordered a medium rump steak was dissapointed when he steak was well done and very dry!! Overall a very bad expierence and one I won't forget in a hurry!!!
reviews.title: Catastrophically bad!!

reviews.text: my wife and i live just a few miles from this hotel,so naturally we dont stay there. however we do frequent the "pub restaurant ", it is a very pleasant outside area in which one can have drink or something to eat.
reviews.title: best fish and chips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the food and service are very good, and very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: waste of time

reviews.text: stayed here a few times but has been going down hill. New manager has taken over and the place lloks cleaner and the staff look more friendly and seem to be enjyong there work more
reviews.title: New manager thank god

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will deffo be back to see how much more the resturant inproves
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night as we were attending a friend's wedding nearby. We walked in and couldn't really work out were to check in, I would say it could use some clear signs telling hotel guests were to check in as we had to wander around for a copuple of minutes and grab a member of staff who told us where to go.
reviews.title: Don't touch the steak!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was easy to find, in terms of road navigation, and seemed close to local amenities, so the location was good. We were expecting a bit of a dive really but when we were shown to our room, by the friendly staff, I was surprised to find it was large, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Needs some serious attention

reviews.text: It had all the amenities you would expect, the only downside was the window wasn't double glazed so it was quite loud outside with the people in the pub below but as we were out for the night anyway it didn't really bother us and it was quiet when we got back. We didn't eat here at night so I can't comment on the evening meals/pub food.
reviews.title: Gutted. My favourite food-pub - ruined.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for beach/promenade and shops/railway station. Warm welcome from friendly staff, good sized comfortable and clean rooms with character. Large car park, great beer garden, excellent choice of food at great prices. Book on-line and get 20% off all food! Leave your email and get complimentary drink. Cooked breakfast ok and also choice of cereals etc.
reviews.title: Worth a visit
Terrible Food
reviews.text: Visited for the first time with friends for Sunday lunch. Ordered the Roast and chose turkey.
This was the worst roast meal I have ever had. The meat was very poor with lots of "bits" and skin, roast potatoes soft, vegetables very overcooked. Would not revisit this restaurant.
reviews.title: What news from Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I keep this simple, when families are out for meals out the last thing they want is a long, long delay in the food arriving. Trying to entertain kids who are hungry will test anyone’s nerves. To add salt to the wounds is the fact when it did arrive, it is not exactly what you ask for!
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Strongly advise other victims to seek other venues unless ofcourse you are on a diet.
reviews.title: Nice Position but Needs Work

reviews.text: Room was lovely and spotlessly clean bed was very comfortable breakfast hit the mark also people where pleasant, will b visiting again
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled up to Hoylake on the 12th Nov from the Portsmouth area (quite a journey) to attend a Birthday party that evening, only to find there was no hot water for people to shower (problem was reported the night before by other guests) so had to go to the party without having shower or being able to wash hair, gas engineer was coming out but we had to leave before it was sorted.
reviews.title: Mixed Review

reviews.text: Ate in restaurant before going out and food was fine and very reasonable 2 for 1 offer. Breakfast next morning was not so good on the menu they mentioned freshly cooked mushrooms I had half a mushroom on my plate !!!!
reviews.title: Things can only get better

reviews.text: Room was rather small but bed very comfortable and the bedding lovely and soft and good quality good nights sleep had.
reviews.title: Well it's going uphill!! 2 for 1 YAY

reviews.text: Small discount was given because of there being no hot water, but as they knew there was a problem the night before it should have been sorted before the following evening.
reviews.title: Good value - bit please sort the table service out
